name: cock
content:
cock noun
(BIRD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] (US also rooster) an adult male chicken: The cock started to crow.
narvikk/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
[ C ] used with the name of a bird to refer to the adult male of that type: a cock robin a cock pheasant

You can also find related words, phrases, and synonyms in the topics:
Hens
cock noun
(PENIS)
[ C ] offensive a rude word for a penis
cock noun
(FORM OF ADDRESS)
UK old-fashioned informal (also cocker, uk/ˈkɒk.ər/ us/ˈkɑː.kɚ/) a friendly form of address, used especially by a man talking to another man: Wotcher, cock! How's things?
cock verb
(TURN)
[ T ] to move a part of your body upwards or in a particular direction: He cocked his head on one side with a slight frown. The dog cocked its leg (= urinated) against a tree. to cock an ear/eyebrow

cock verb
(PREPARE GUN)
[ T ] to push the necessary piece of a gun up into position so that it is ready to fire: He cocked his rifle and took aim.
